title: Beautiful church
review: A beautiful church well maintained. At nature's serenity. If you are staying near Gandhi Chowk, take a walk till tip n top and you will be able to find all attractions on the way. St John's Church, St Mary Church, bhulla taal and tip n top.

title: Not worth your time
review: The Church is located close to Tip-N-Top Point in Lansdowne. That's one of the reasons that many tourists stop here before going to Tip-N-top Point.

title: Nice place to visit: calm all around
review: We reached there on a day when the church remains closed. Just had a walk around the beautiful place.

title: Nice place to go with devotion
review: Next to tip on top, this church is a bonus for the faithful . You can spend as much time in a godly environment . Once in Landsdowne , the locals always stress to visit this church.

title: Opens on Sat and Sun only nice to visit overall
review: We went there on Wednesday and came to know it remains closed on all other days and opens on sat and sunday.

title: The mary's church
review: When we visited the church was closed but could see the outside which felt like the old british time churches , on the corner of a hill.

title: Gem of a Place!
review: St Mary's Church is one of the places you must go to while you visit Lansdowne. It is situated near Tip-in-Top view point.

title: just another church
review: its a very small church... you can just take a click on the way and carry on..not worthy enough to get out of your car and spend time..

title: Quick Look
review: This church reminds you of the British heritage that existed there. There is nothing much to do and it falls on the way to the Tip Top Point. You can take a quick look if you are into history. Maybe click a few monochrome pictures for Instagram, but that's about it!

title: A lovely place
review: We love visiting the churches. It was a lovely reminisent of an era still represting history nicely. The construction itself reminds you of the past. One if can be bit patient with te history and photographs etc, can be worth.

title: Historical
review: The place is historical with Lansdowne evolution.  Location is just short of tip-in-top and a getaway to natural beauty.

title: Quiet Church
review: St. Mary's church, when we visited was an empty place, it was open but no one was there so i guess its like that always, however the interior were nice & clean. A must place to visit

title: Well maintained, quaint church....
review: Tiny Room... no Pastor... seemed deserted for a long time... couldn't enter since it was locked !!

title: Small and devine
review: In Lansdowne just less than kilometre before Tip-N-top the highest point of Lansdowne, St. Mary Church stands quietly. Just stop for few minutes as it is small but well maintained. Bow your head in front of the alter you will find peace. Surrounding is beautiful and clean. Worth to stop for some quiet and devine times.

title: Just 200 meters from GMVN and TIP ToP
review: Near to tip top point .. Sunday open, I m new for churches but admire architecture hence we stopped and clicked few pics.

title: Small nice old church
review: Church is very close to tip and top point and is quite old and beautiful. We went there when it was raining so that kind of added to the beauty of the place

title: Good
review: i have not specifically visited there but while moving on the roads i have seen this church but its closed , outer infrastructure is good.

title: Vacations
review: St.Marys Church Is Beautifull N Peacefull Place Near Lansdowne Mall Road But U Need A Guide Here To Gain Knowledge About The Place .

title: Ancient church - Old fashioned Structure
review: This is one of the attraction and dont miss if you visit Lansdowne.

title: Historical Site
review: Small church but very elegant. We saw a small video on Garhwal regiment it was quite an eye opener on Lansdowne.

title: Old Heritage that's It
review: Only characteristic is that Its around 125 years old, nothing else. Nothing has been maintained or stored to view about its history or heritage. Just a blank Hall, not even good statue of Jesus. It may have its value due to its surroundings and Hilli area.

title: A quint small church
review: Beautiful church right on the nook of the road. Its a small church surrounded with trees, fantastic view of the mountains and quite lovely streets.

title: Please confirm the timings
review: It is a nice small place, but unfortunately, when we reached (at about 12 PM), it was closed down. Also, no board or notice was written regarding its timings.

title: Very Peaceful Church
review: If you want peace, this the place for you. Very Neat and clean, beautiful church and very peaceful. It is near Bhulla Lake and enroute to Tip N Top.

title: Peace and tranquility
review: This church and the surrounding area is maintained by the Indian Army and they have done an amazing job. The church even shows a video movie detailing the history of the area and the monument.

title: Nice and Clean
review: This seems to be a very old church. It is open only on Sat-Sun. It is nice architecture and very clean premises. Visit on your Lansdowne trip.

title: Good
review: Typical hill station type peaceful church , very neat and clean and it opens only on saturday and sundays .

title: Nice Small Church
review: Its just like any other Church clean and Silent. But they run a special documentary here on Saturdays based on Garhwal Rifles. But you need to check it before going there as it is upon the sole discretion of the church as well as the local administration to run the documentary, They can cancel it upon their wish. The place is just 5 - 10 minutes watch

title: Himalayan view
review: Lansdowne is only place where virginitie of mountains can be viewed.

title: Simple Peaceful Church
review: This is a simple, peaceful church which comes on one's way up to Tip-in-Top Point. There is also a short film (ticket: Rs. 20) on the history of Lansdowne that is played inside the Church premises.

title: beautiful gothic structure
review: Built in the way to Tip & Top, it has clean clear cut lines with beautiful interiors and old pews. worth the visit.

title: nice location
review: it's located near tip n top. nearby areas and quite and peaceful. There are benches outside the church, You can spend couple of hours here.

title: Nice
review: Has a bell dating back to 1892 which has been preserved. A small prayer hall which has a quiet ambience. Moved around the church, went to the view point nearby.

title: Hill station church
review: This church is located on the way to Tip-n-Top. When I visited it, the church was closed. So I just passed 10-15 minutes there. But from outside it was big and architecture was nice. There are two churches in Lansdowne, this one is the bigger one.

title: Mesmerizing Gothic architecture..
review: Like any other hill station, Lansdowne too has its own share of churches. It is situated on a hill top and apart from the architecture, the highlight was the bell which dates back to 1892. The church is very well kept and is a must go.

title: Quaint little Church!
review: Even in my 7th visit to Lansdowne, I could not stop myself in visiting this little church. It speaks of history which is written in its walls and the small compound that it is built in! These days, they show a movie on Garhwal Rifles inside the church which I personally feel is a hindrance to the inner beauty of the church. Also, the Church is not open on all days for public.

title: Awesome movie on Garhwal Rifles
review: We saw 30 minutes movie on Garhwal Rifles Indian army and it was amazing. Proud of your India Army, jai hind

title: Ancient church
review: Ancient church with old fashioned structure. One of the must see places around Lansdowne. As the total place is under Army control, best visit before 5.30pm

title: Church
review: The church is maintained by Garhwal Regiment and reminds of British presence in yesteryear. You get a good feel.

title: Maintained well and located just on the road.
review: The church is located just on the way to Tip in Top. You can just get down and take a shot. Well maintained and serene atmosphere.

title: Lovely church.
review: A beautiful church in the Hills. Especially in evening with multicoloured lights thrown on it, it looks wow. Great for day time photography too. Lovely place for worship!

title: Abode of peace
review: This place reminds me of old village walk at Insbruck-Austria. The beautiful road passing by and the wonderful structure of the old church is really a place to stop by and worth a nice stroll. Its a small church which is usually open on Saturdays & Sundays and closed on weeddays. But the army personnel opens the church door even on weekdays if there are number of visitors and tourists arrives-very nice gesture indeed.

title: Better to  give it a miss
review: This is a small old  church with nothing much to enjoy. However, on the side the  valley view is  quite  superb.

title: Nice Church with a military touch
review: I am always fascinated by churches and don’t leave an opportunity to visit one. This church is nice and has a military touch to it. When I went inside, a military based movie was being played on the projector and I didn’t get to spend much time there, hence no pictures.

title: Just a ordinary church
review: it is one of the church in the town you can see it when u return from tip and top. You can spend 20-30 minutes at this place. During evening hours Garhwal riffles place a small move of 20 minutes briefing about them. which you may like as it contact with past.

title: An old church with a very beautiful scenic view
review: The church is quite old and looks magestic due to its victorian architecture. Its nearby tip-n-top point so can be visited together. Please check the timings of the place with the locals as we were unable to get inside as it was closed. But the view from across the road is very beautiful.

title: Beautiful is the word
review: The church is beautiful and very well located.

title: Nothing to tell about
review: It's just an old church. Entry is prohibited. So what's the use of visiting it?!

title: Its all about peace and nature in one place
review: The beautiful Catholic Church located amidst green and serene surroundings offering peace and tranquility is of historical importance. Established in 1895 and constructed by Col A H B Hume.It maintained by army cantonment .

title: a 120 year old small church
review: we trekked from our hotel to the church. the third time that we visited the church.

title: Beautiful church! Must see :)
review: This is a gorgeous little church close to the town centre of lansdowne. Looks like one of those chapels in English countryside, perfect for a small dreamy wedding. Set up next to a curving road and against a drop of forests, this place is surreal :)

title: Dark and dimlit Church
review: Not really that great a maintenance, very poor lighting and nothing much to offer. It is a church and nothing more. They could have a gift shop.

title: Beautiful Historical Church with amazing view
review: A must visit place in the city of Lansdowne. Small church with beautiful surroundings. View from the bench outside the church is superb. In a clear day, You can see snow covered peaks too. Good enough for 1 hour visit.

title: Great!!
review: This place has to be walked down to because of narrower roads and its closing time. A quaint church with rustic old look but very peaceful.

title: Beautiful Church !
review: On the way to Tip n Top point, this is a nice church. However not very well maintained by Govt. Good to spend some time in peace.

title: A church that beckons!
review: Very nice church and brilliantly lit at night with colours changing ever so often.  Unfortunately it is only open on some days with timings.Worth a visit and a little history to match. Do not forget to make three special wishes!!!

title: beautiful monument. extremely well maintained.
review: extremely well maintained structure. Gives a beautiful glimpse into British architecture in India. Just make sure to check on timings since it only opens for some time during the day.

title: Very peaceful place
review: Unlike other tourist places, this place is very calm inside as well as out side. The nature lovers won't stop taking photographs of its surrounding which if full of greenery and flowers.

title: Beautiful!
review: This is the most beautiful and ancient church in lansdowne. The place is covered with trees and red flowers. Very quite and peaceful too.

title: Serene
review: The church is located up in a corner after crossing some uphill roads. Nice view of the Himalayas and a peaceful place

title: Nice
review: Cant Comment Much as it was closed during our Visit although we went within the Openings Hours. But A Nice Architecture.

title: Nice Location
review: Church is near the top of the mountain. But please check the timings before you go there. Not a Big halt point but stopping and checking the view and enjoying the charming weather is worth. Timings generally 7:00AM to 10:00AM and 3:30PM to 5:00PM .

title: Nice view
review: We could not enter the premises as it was closed (we are not aware of working hours). But the location is very good and offers a nice view. The church itself looked quite ancient and pretty from outside.

title: Closed before time
review: Was closed at least ten minutes before 1 pm. So could not go in. Took photographs outside as we munched on peanuts.  Trash cans were available but some tourists preferred to use the hill slopes.

title: Heritage
review: St. Mary's church is maintained by Garhwal Rifles  but needs maintenance and repair. It is a page out of history. It is no longer used for worship but beautiful and full of nostalgia.You can watch a video on heritage nd accolades of garhwal rifles here.

title: Old Artistic Architectural Church of British Era
review: Old Artistic Architectural Church of British era.Good location, quiet having an old nostalgic feeling.

title: Nice quiant church from the british era
review: This is a very nice quaint church which provides a throwback from to the british or the colonial era. Few things to keep in mind is that it only open on selected days and also on those days it remains closed between 1:00 pm  - 3:30 pm

title: Ancient Church
review: This Church is one of the of the old church and you are able connect it. However, it is not open for general public for their visit. So you may get a bit annoyed to have not seen it from inside. It had very good surrounding of nature and sitting around the church id decent experience.

title: Peaceful place
review: Spend some time in this old church, it will calm your mind.

title: Lasndown trip
review: Small and old church but very nice and quiet, Good view from the church road. Garhwal rifles show a movie in the church, if you have time spend 20 mins for this movie.

title: New Year 2017
review: A timid Church amongst Nature. We couldn't see the Interiors as It was closed. But the Exterior is well maintained.

title: A quiet place, some silent moments well spent...
review: It is on the way to Tiffin Top, on the road side only. You can spend some time within enjoying the quiet (if not meditating or praying) before you go on up.

title: St Mary's Church
review: It's a very cool and calm place to worship God whatever your belief is. Very neat and clean everywhere.

title: ancient
review: this is the oldest church in lansdowne and has a cute little writ up on a marriage that took place there in the 19th century. fully wooden with the flooring sagging in places, it is quaint and charming. the church is open only on saturdays and sundays.

title: Cute little church with nice views
review: It comes on the way to Tip n Top. A flight of stairs leads one to this small and peaceful church with amazing views. Not a place to stay for long, just for a quick stop

title: Nice church near tip n top point in lansdowne
review: It is very near tip n top point in lansdowne,  open on sat and sun only, nice place to visit.  it had nice garden outside as well.

title: Holy Place- Not a Tourist Attraction-Needs Maintenance!
review: A lot of people has been asking me If they should visit St. Mary's Chruch. First thing first this is not a Tourist Attraction. It is was once a holy place so lets respect that. It is an ancient building. The place stand tall and was built in 1895. This has been turned into more of a museum telling stories of the pre-independence era. A lot of pictures from the same era can be seen. They have an Audio-visual display of history. All this is converted by the Garhwal regiment people.

title: Amazing feel
review: St. Mary's church is maintained by Garhwal Rifles and only open to public on Saturdays and Sundays. It is a page out of history. It is no longer used for worship but beautiful and full of nostalgia.

title: An era gone by
review: this little church, although no longer a place of worship, has its own distinctive charm, especially on Sunday evenings when it is lit up.

title: Serene and calm
review: The church is located up in a corner after crossing some uphill roads.  But the climb / drive is worth it given the serene and calm church.  It's a small structure,  but worth visiting.

title: Weekend tripping
review: A small and very beautiful church from the british time. A must watch place to see and much watch the short film there for a very minimal amount of rs 10

title: One of the ancient church from Raj Era.
review: Wonderful tucked away old style church from Raj era. It has other points for sight seeing places. Can be covered on foot from main Lansdown bus-stand.

title: St Mary Church
review: Beautiful lacation and a very peaceful place. You can easily reach this place via Road or by Trekking.

title: Historic
review: Visit this place and must see the short film on Garwhal Rifles history. Visit before 5.30 in the evening.

title: Another church in Lansdowne.!
review: As per my review for St. John's church, DO NOT TAKE ANY CAB,

title: Good church
review: I was going back from tip in top to lansdowne market at the evening, suddenly I saw this church with lights. It was looking so beautiful in different lights.

title: An unforgettable walk into history
review: One of the best spots in the Teri Garhwal region.... for genuine history lovers, this is a beautiful church steeped in history and truly a magical sight...small yet with its gothic architecture and its location, this truly serves as a whiff of fresh air both in terms of the walk to reach there and then spending some time inside.

title: St Mary's Church in Lansdowne
review: When you visit Lansdowne this is one of the tourist attraction which the locals will take you. Nothing great about this old building except the stained glass and preserved statues.

title: Beautiful Church
review: nice place. so much relaxing environment. You can sit around, trek nearby.. Very peaceful. they play some small video too.. (not sure of exact timing)

title: St. Mary's Church
review: Must visit this place in early morning, noon & late in evening. At night reaching here is bit challenging because locals always restrict you going here because of leopards and other animals.

title: Picture perfect
review: Cute & small church with good history situated in perfect location and very well maintained ... I drove past the church 10/12 times and everytime it caught me eye

title: Another Church in Lansdowne
review: Slightly larger than the St John's church - both Churches are very close by (couple of minutes drive away) and both can be quickly covered in 15 mins each.

title: Nicely Constructed
review: This is a nice looking small church unlike the huge structures made for churches in other parts of country. Sit here to be cool and take a good view of valley from front of this church.

title: Old time church, nice documentary!!!
review: The documentary for about 20 mins that is shown at the church is about the Garhwal Rifles and is quite informative. The Church is a small one, yet a pretty one- so pictures can be taken but apart from the documentary, one would not spend more than 5-10 mins there. Also, the church is closed in the after for around 2-3 hours, so be careful not to visit between 1-4 pm.

title: Quiet, quaint place, and close to Tip in Top view point
review: A very old building, located in a nice backdrop. You can stop at this church,  on your way to the view point. There isn't much to do in Lansdowne, however you will feel refreshed after visiting this small hill station.

title: A good palce to visit
review: If you are out on a trip to visit a place in Lansdowne and do not trek for it, this is the best site. You can go all the way on foot here and then enjoy a peaceful and wonderful time. Very good architecture.

title: Reminiscence and reflection of past
review: inside, the monochrome wedding pictures held in the church from that era gives you a certain hit of nostalgia. There was a projector too (may be they had shows of history of this town from British era) but again the timings, so, we just came back to our hotel the same way.

title: Just 5 mins !
review: On the road to Tip-in-top , can only view it from outside if its not open. Just a check list if visiting Lansdowne.

title: Old World Charm
review: In a time when all the constructions are boxy and without any personality this building is a refreshing change. Complete with the stained glass windows it is very attractive and a good place for selfies and group photographs.

title: Quite place to worship
review: Quite place for worshippers, enjoy side beauty of lansdowne and having view of nature and beauty.......

title: St. Mary's Church Lansdowne, a very very old Roman Catholic Church built by the Britishers
review: St. Mary's Church a lovely and a holy place and for every tourist to be there, it brings a lot of charm to the place and surrounding. It is a jewel in the heart of this small hill station, main tourist attraction and people go there to visit and offer up their prayers, and is very close to Tip N top with a  calm environment.  It is a Roman Catholic Church built by the Britishers earlier has been under the army but has been handed over to the Catholic diocese, the Church services i.e the Mass celebrations take place at the St. John's Church and a resident priest has been assigned for this purpose, who stays within the Church premises.

title: Gud place to Worship
review: St. Mary's Church is good and Quite place for worshippers. Very Peaceful Place and also having awesome view of nature.

title: Calm and nice chruch
review: They present a video here and they charge some amount for you to see it. Video will give you a insight of Garwal rifles.

title: A small Church
review: Small Church on the way to Tip n Top. We were lucky to reach when they were just about to start the video about the history of Garhwal Rifles. They play 20 mins short film about the cantonment town of Lansdowne in the church at nominal fee of Rs. 10. It is open only on the weekends

title: Small Church facing Nature
review: Unfortunately this church is closed on week days and hence apart the church compound nothing else could be seen.

title: Peaceful lawns
review: Sat in the lawns of the church for a long time, reading a book, meditating, bird watching, soaking in the sounds and smells of nature. The church itself was closed when I visited, but this place should definitely be on your to-do list if you are a nature lover. Visit in the morning. Jump the gate if it is closed!

title: Beautiful chruch
review: St Mary's church is on the way to tip-n-top. The church has timings for opening. Mostly during morning and evening time. We could not visit inside the church.

title: Only open on Weekends, at a great location.
review: Plan your visit accordingly, this is only open on Weekends.

title: Good
review: Situated at very nice place.Small ,this church is more than hundred year old.

title: Quintessential Church!
review: I absolutely loved this church. It was an easy walk from the Mall area in Lansdowne. Downside is this church is open only on Saturdays and Sundays. On these two days, the church authorities show a small documentary on a projector screen. There is a wish pond inside as well.

title: Calmness
review: This church has been maintained nicely. It is open only on Saturday and Sunday and is closed during lunch hours.

title: history telling the saga of garhwal rifles
review: This is very nicely maintain church where you can see a 20 min movie which tells you about garhwal rifle in just rs 10. You can make your wish in church by throwing change in holy water. Opens on Sat and sun

title: Peaceful
review: St. Mary's church is located very near to tip n top point . Church is very small. U can see the pictures of jesus christ in the church n books related to christianity. There is a wishing well also.

title: Very peaceful
review: Nice and very peaceful place... right at the turn.

title: Nice little old Church
review: It is a small chuch, very neat and clean. It is maintained by the Army. You can see this on way to Tip in Top. If you have time, you can watch 20 minutes movie on the glory of Army and the church.

title: Heritage building
review: ~125-150 yrs old building will take you to Victorian era. It was presented by soldiers to British queen.

title: Old but beautiful
review: A small but very old church on the way to Tip-n-Top. You can imagine that you have seen the church in many of the movies. But i feel sorry as choose the wrong time as the church was closed.

title: Just another church
review: On the way to & from Tip N Top, we came across the church which looked interesting. A small structure, we found it closed most of the times we crossed it. Finally on our last day, we found it open and went inside for a quick prayer. The outer architecture is more interesting than the interiors. The floors creaked. A small garden provides for a photo-op.

title: Just another spot
review: I am unsure of what one has to review here. Its a small church located in Lansdowne. The surrounding area is quiet and undisturbed. Its a short distance from the view point that one can walk across. Nothing overtly spectacular about the place.

title: Peaceful
review: St.Mary church is almost at the top of the hill.Located very near to GMVN hilltop .The church is one place where they show a twenty minutes movie on the projector on history of garwhal rifles.This we enjoyed @10/person.The church is open on Saturday and Sunday.On weekdays church is open from 8-10 in morning and 3-6 in evening!

title: Brilliant architechture
review: St. Mary's church opens only on saturdays and sundays when they screen a film about history of lansdowne as well as Garhwal rifles. It is located at a crossraod and the view from the road in front is mesmerizing. This small church has a beautiful architechture.

title: Peaceful!!
review: The church opens only on Saturdays and Sundays and they screen a film about history of Lansdowne and the Garhwal Regiment. It is very near to Tip-N-Top and the view from the road in front is very good.

title: old church
review: its an old church. its quite peaceful inside. st. mary's church and tip top point can be visited together . also lansdowne market is nearby.

title: St. Mary Church
review: Its a good location and a old church. The specialty is that it has a bell hug on its door like a hindu temple which is uncommon in a church. nice location but nothing else.

title: This church is good to visit
review: It is situated at a very nice place surrounded by lush green trees. Must be a one time watch although there was no priest available when visited this place

title: Average place
review: Average place, just some distance away from st. john church. View from there is good and the place is neat and clean.

title: good
review: Weather was amazing near the Church and very peaceful. There is a road which go towards right from the church, go there and spend some time in the nature.

title: lansdowne church
review: I have visited this place on September 2014.  Also I saw a movie. Movie is related to garhwal rifles.

title: It's a pretty quaint little church
review: Now a museum of sorts with a movie of the Garwal Rifles history.

title: St. Mary's Church in Landsdowne
review: Quaint little church with a bit of history- being built in 1896. we don't think it is open all the time, but we got lucky as a group was being shown a documentary inside.

title: St Mary's Church
review: Very quite place. Nicely maintained. We offered prayers on Saturday and saw the garhwal rifles movie at a very nominal cost of rs 10.  It is very near to tip n top.

title: Do watch the movie played here
review: Movie for 15 mins is played here and costs 10 rs pp. its closed on sunday and maintained by Army. Watch this movie and then go to museum, it will make a lots of sense

title: quiet place
review: this church has been well restored by GRRC..a nice small movie on the history of Garhwal Regt is also available..just short of Tip n Top..do visit

title: lovely Church
review: Except that it is open only on saturday and sunday ... oops I visited on Friday. it is placed in one of the calmest place on earth

title: Old church.
review: this is an old church and was under renovation. nothing much to see. its on the way and may stop for 5 minutes.

title: Small but beautiful
review: For those who admire heritage, a good place to spend 10-15 min. Surroundings are beautiful. Check the timings before you visit.

title: A small b'ful & Old Church.
review: Very Calm place and when you look at the church you will get the feeling that you have seen it somewhere....  ;)

title: Small Church, Can be skipped
review: This is a small church with some history on the way to tip n top. There is nothing spectacular about it and you may skip it if there is a time crunch.

title: Church from old days - another one
review: We were lucky to reach there on time as the prayer was going on.  It makes you believe, god is present there.

title: Pretty picture
review: Its a small old church on the way to Tip n top point. Has a small lawn and a green gate with large trees all around. It's supposed to be maintained by the army as a museum. We went in the morning once and again in the evening. However it was closed both times.

title: A Magnificent Structure
review: While on return from Tip-in-Top, we stopped by for St. Mary’s Church.

title: Small nice Church
review: The church is very small but well kept.

title: Must visit!
review: Loved it! once again, love that GRRC has maintained this beautiful work of architecture so well. I missed the regiment movie that is screened everyday at 11 am but am sure it has a lot of info on the Garhwal regiment and should be very interesting.

title: Get connected to St. Mary
review: It is a beautiful church, this was not my first time to a church, but my experience was this how a church should, a quiet place, and if you like to meditate, then meditate or pray. A must visit place when you are at Lansdowne.

title: nice Church with a history
review: this church is not very far from the lake so you may easily visit if you want on your way. It has some history to it and the details mentioned in the church. It also has a bowl like wishing well.

title: Small church - part of Lansdowne history
review: St Mary’s Church in Lansdowne near the Tip-N-Top is a small church. Necessitated by the religious and social activities of the Christian army personnel of the Garhwal Rifles its construction started in 1895 by Lieutenant Hume of the Royal Engineers and completed in 1896. Came into disuse after 1947. Later renovated by the Garhwal Rifles of the India Army and they maintain it properly. However, no church service is conducted now. It has a picture gallery and some memorabilia depicting various activities like marriage and other social activities held at the church during those days. One can see a movie show on the Garhwal Rifles inside the church.

title: St. Mary's Church, Lansdowne
review: The Church is as excellent place to visit while in Lansdowne. Very picturesque surroundings and exceptionally peaceful place.

title: A regular church
review: Do watch the 20 minutes documentary on Garhwal Rifles. It is definitely not a waste of time. INR 20 per person is the fee.

title: St.Mary' Church
review: This is an old church which has been renovated and restored by the Garhwal Rifles men and is also maintained by them. Religious ceremonies are not as such performed in the church. A Garwhal Rifles personnel is present there during opening hours to explain and attend to the tourists. There are several Garwhal Rifles memorabilia placed inside and a projector is also installed inside on which a short 20 minutes film on the inception and history of Garwhal Rifles is shown on a very nominal price. The overall experience is good.

title: Peaceful
review: Do watch the 20 mins documentary. It's about Gaharwal Regiment. Church is ver small but is also the oldest church. It's on the way to Tip & Top view.

title: Lovely...
review: This church is a very old church which has a facility of a 20 minute documentary being shown to its visitor’s on a big LCD Projector for a mere 10 bucks...worth a history of a lifetime about the Garhwal Rifles and Battalions of Lansdowne! It's a well maintained and quaint church to visit..

title: Must Visit
review: The history of Landsdowne is associated with it, the Church is a beautiful structure both Internally and externally...

title: Good
review: We liked the walk to the church more exciting. There is a shade infront of the church where you can enjoy the scenic view and the awesome weather.

title: Love the Church.
review: The location of the Church is simply beautiful. And near by the Church there is a bench to sit from where you can see the whole valley. And Church looks like something straight from the Textbooks. Its just a small Church but the way it is build and maintained is simply lovely,

title: Small but well kept
review: This is one of the 2 churches on the way to tip-and-top. Since there r not much to see in Lansdowne - so one can go there to spend some time. Nothing great though but better than other places in lansdowne.

title: Just one of the sights
review: Just for heritage purposes, a protestant church managed by the Garhwal Rifles (since the other church, St Johns is catholic). What you can see is largely the british architecture and walls, the rest of it as the keeper informed us has been moved into the Garhwal mess since some of the visitors managed to spoil things like the piano in the past.

title: Historical monument
review: Nice and beautiful church, made by englishman before freedom, presently manage by indian army. Its  not so far from main market and on the way to tip in top.

title: A small church worth visiting once
review: At Lansdown you do not have much things to do. Better to visit this church where you will find nature's beauty. This is on the way to Santoshi Mata temple. You can see this church while visiting Tip-n-Top and Santoshi Mata temple.
